title: Forbidden Worlds (ACG)
description:
Forbidden Worlds was a fantasy comic from the American Comics Group, which won the 1964 Alley Award for Best Regularly Published Fantasy Comic.

Forbidden Worlds initial subtitle "Exploring the supernatural!", debuted in October 1951.  The comic was replaced by Young Heroes from February until October 1955, when it reappeared with #35 and the altered subtitle "Stories of strange adventure".  From #108 on, it became sporadically bimonthly instead of strictly monthly.  #114 and #116 were special issues called Forbidden Worlds presents Herbie, featuring Herbie Popnecker, who was created in Forbidden Worlds #73 (December 1958). #125 to #138 all featured Magicman on the cover. The final issue was #145 (August 1967), when the company stopped producing newsstand comic books.

Most of the contents of Forbidden Worlds,from 1957 to 1967, including Magicman and Herbie, was written by Richard E. Hughes under a plethora of pseudonyms. Artists which contributed include Pete Costanza for Magicman and Ogden Whitney for Herbie.  Other occasional contributors include Hy Eisman, John Buscema, Paul Reinman and Chic Stone.


Released on http://ComicPirates.info
